content: Edit: Auto-upload is only uploading pictures, no other file-types. I hope the developers read this.  The issue is the version of Nextcloud being ran.  I have been using the plugin on my Freenas box which is not upgradable, and is version 10.0.1.  I just built out Nextcloud 13.0 in a separate jail from scratch, and the app works perfectly, no login loop.  The app should be compatible with all versions.  Or perhaps put out 3.01 of the app as a separate app for older versions of Nextcloud.  Depending on the size of people's environments, and whether or not this is in a production environment, pros may not want to fully rebuild their Nextcloud installation, and the app must work.  The only reason why I''m not giving it 5 stars is because i was actually considering using Nextcloud in production for a client, and now I don't think i can because buggy releases like that would be very bad for business, and quite frankly, is somewhat unacceptable.  These aren't windows patches that we control and test before rolling out, most people use their personal cell phones and all apps update automatically.  Releases must be fully vetted before going into production.
replyContent: Hi Shaibal, like you said the client works with newer versions of Nextcloud which is simply due to the fact that Nextcloud 10 is end of life since 2017 and even Nextcloud 11 will be in May 2018. So the clients are tested with actually supported server versions. Not keeping a server up to date has do be considered a security risk by definition!

content: NextCloud is a great way of keeping your data, yours. However, in comparison to DSFile from Synology, it is less intuitive and much slower. For example, DSFile has the ability to understand if you're on the local network and as such, then use that to connect, rather than routing out to the public internet and back in everytime which is much slower when uploading files. I suppose fundamentally they work differently, but I'd like to see more of a DSFile port, for my own selfish reasons :)

Log off can be found in "manage accounts", but then you have to re-setup everything.
